intro: Nototriche violacea, commonly known as violetleaf nototriche, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often tinged with violet or purple hues. Its flowers are small and clustered in dense, spherical inflorescences, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Nototriche violacea is adapted to moist, woodland habitats and plays a role in supporting local pollinator populations.
